metadata.title: CVE-2024-38632 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:vfio/pci: fix potential memory leak in vfio_intx_enable() Ifvfio_irq_ctx_alloc() failed will lead to 'name' memory leak.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-38632` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic-lpae - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-extra-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.11.0-12.19').
linux-lts-xenial: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-aws: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-azure: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
